ICE-FISHING If you drive north from Toronto for three hours you come to Lake Nipissing. In winter the lake becomes ice and thousands of Canadian fishermen travel there each weekend. They build little houses of wood on the ice and paint them in bright colours. Then they sit inside to catch the fish that swim under the ice. In summer the fishing is even better and the lake is ice-free. You can fish from a boat or take a canoe. You have to follow all the rules on safety. You need to keep your feet on the ice. You can’t go into the water and swim. Fishing can be fun. You can fish for any kind of fish - snapper, walleye, herring and even salmon. If you are lucky you can catch the king salmon, which you can take back to Quebec. If you catch a big fish you can even share it with all your friends, because they love salmon. It's more fun if you go ice fishing in winter because the ice is so cold and solid. You can sit on the boat and look at the lake while you fish. It can be very relaxing. If you are a big hunter like me you can have a special day on the ice with your dog. There are many trails in the lake for you and your dog to walk on and chase after your food. When you are very tired you can go and lie down in the forest on a bench and have a hot chocolate with your friend. It's more relaxing than sitting on the ice with your dog. Fishing is a great hobby. People from all over the world come to have fun there. In winter you can travel there by car. In summer you can drive there in a canoe. It is a great hobby. This activity is very beautiful. For a minute he looked down at me carefully. (We look at a small animal in the same way and think: 'Will it hurt me? No. It is my foot that will hurt me!) Then he said to me'Why are you shouting?'I answered:'It is my foot that will hurt me!'The man looked down again at my feet. Then,'Go  to the next field'He told his colleague to carry the man to the next field. The following day (it was Sunday) the colleague called me. He told me that he had taken the man to the hospital. When I told him that I had looked at the foot, the man told me he would not mind walking home. At 5.00 p.m., as planned, I got off the train. I began to walk towards home. But, before reaching home, I heard a noise:'It has broken the glass in my shoe.'I rushed back home. That evening my mother was angry with me. At 6.00 p.m., as planned, I got on the train to leave for the airport. I sat on a corner of the car and began to think about what to do. A policeman arrived. At 7.00 p.m., as planned, I got on the plane to return home.

New books this month The Long Night This is David Reilly's first book. David became a writer after teaching English for several years. Maha is a nurse in northern Australia where she works in a small hospital. One day a baby is so ill that Maha has to drive all night to get her to the nearest big city. The book is set in a small town so it is all too familiar in many ways. There are some very funny scenes about how ordinary people cope in a remote rural part of Australia, like the way a couple of locals go round in a circle in the middle of the night, trying to get to the neighbours house to fetch some firewood. It does seem a bit silly though and a bit like a spoof. I've read it several times since I've read about it last year and it's always fun. You can buy it from most bookshops. The Long Night by David Reilly.
The Summer of Fear by David Mitchell This is David Mitchell's second book and if you like your books a bit dark, it will be a good choice. It's set in Northern England in the late 1970's and it's about a bunch of friends who start going out on dangerous walks in the woods in search of a mythical beast. Sometimes they find it, sometimes they don't. It's about the journey they go on together rather than their journey through the woods, and if you've read the first book I'm not sure if the plot would be clear enough for you to follow. There are lots of different parts to the book to keep you occupied. I can see it being a real pleasure to read for a long period of time. Big cats There are many different kinds of cats. They are different in size and they do not look or act the same. Tigers are the biggest cats. From head to tail they can be 3.7m long. Most cats don't like water but tigers will often lie in a pool of water when it is hot! Lions are big and can grow up to 4.5m in length. They are usually spotted and will run at full speed in the wild. They are not known for their stealth and are very vocal. Most cats don't like to be touched. They are not afraid of humans but they may bite. Bears are the smallest cats. These animals are normally smaller than a wolf and grow about a foot long. They are typically black in colour and will live in the woods. Wolves are the most dangerous animal for humans. They look like cats but they have a larger body. They are very dangerous and their hunting instincts is second to none. They have huge teeth and are capable of ripping flesh. Crocodiles are the smallest animals. They are 1.8m long but can grow up to 4m in length. Crocodiles are mainly found in the Amazon. They are harmless animals that like to stay in the water. The smallest of all, is the puma. They are smaller than any of the above mentioned animals and have a fur that makes them look like a lion. The puma is the smallest cat and is known for being ferocious. They will fight to the death if it comes to it and will not hesitate to attack people if provoked. These animals will only eat meat from the animals they hunt.

Then I said: 'I was right when I said the plague is not contagious. I feel better when I am at home than when I am in my house in the city.' 'And what about you?' POSTCARDS Today people like to send postcards to their friends and family. These postcards often have pictures of beaches mountains or castles on them and you can write a message on the back. Many people send postcards when they are on holiday because postcards are cheap and the pictures on them are often better than people's own photos.
POSTCARDS are also very personal and you can write a message that will always be there for your family members, friends or family. Many people also like to send postcards to famous places on Earth such as the Alps, the Grand Canyon and the Himalayas because they are places that are well known by people.

Postcards are very affordable and often you can find them cheap on the web. When you get a postcard with good pictures from the web, do not forget to send a thank you and some letters. Send postcards with good quality pictures, include the original postcard and a personal message.

There are many websites that sell postcards. You can also send postcards yourself using websites such as Etsy, Card Kingdom and others. Postcards can also be made at home using home printing techniques and you can buy small cards from this type of websites. These postcards also can be bought on the internet with good prices.

People around the world usually postcards using snail mail so postcards are also very practical.

Postcards are fun and are a great way to pass your holiday and to express your feelings to others.

The history of horse racing From the first history books ever written it is clear that horse racing has always been an important sport. It started in Central Asia about 4500 years ago and was a favourite sport in both Greek and Roman times. Modern horse racing began when Arab horses were brought to Europe in the 12th century. In France in the 16th century the first thoroughbred race was organised. Horse racing in England began in the mid-17th century and began to boom during the Industrial Revolution. Racing in France was banned in 1870, but a horse was later stolen and killed at the Meurthe-et-Moselle Racecourse in 1870, causing a boom in horse racing during the next 10 years. Racing was later banned again during the First World War, but was eventually reinstated after the war. It has become a part of many cultures, in particular being played at the Olympics and in many other international sports events. In the UK there is a thriving professional racing industry. Most horse racing is of the jockeys’ formality variety, but there are now two professional racing tracks in Europe, Chantilly and Chantilly International in France. The last professional track was closed in 1995. The professional racing industry was heavily influenced by the American horse racing industry. Today there is much more international racing than there was in the 1930s and racing has been a big part of the British economy for a long time. Racing is now played in many other countries, including Australia and Singapore. More than 90 percent of the horses in England are owned by an individual and a large proportion of these horses are not harnessed to a racehorse and are referred to as workhorses. Bill Prince-Smith Bill Prince-Smith was a farmer and a teacher and a dentist before he became a writer of children's books at the age of 60. Now thirteen years later he has written more than 80 books. Every day he goes into his office and writes. In the evening he gives the work to his wife to read. One of them is "The Three Little Monkeys" and the others are "Molly's Magical Puppy" and "The Three Little Pudding Peeps". The title of the first one is based on what he sees in his own kitchen. "The Three Little Monkeys" has an interesting story about a cat, a dog and a monkey who like to eat cakes. In the last story a duck has fallen into the saucepan and, just before, it gets a delicious chocolate pudding. His books are sold everywhere, in Germany alone, but especially in children's bookstores. His most popular ones are "The Three Little Pudding Peeps" and "The Three Little Monkeys". He enjoys writing because he can read a sentence aloud without getting tired. One of his friends says that in his office he often gets up and starts reading to himself out of curiosity. Sometimes his secretary has to help him because his speech seems to slow down. However, that does not bother him, because he is a teacher after all. His secret to long speech making is simply "humility". He teaches children how to read and write with kindness and gentleness. All his children and grandchildren now have their own children's books that they like and, in spite of the competition in the German market, they enjoy their books very much. In his free time, Bill Prince-Smith likes to read to his grandchildren or to go on a holiday. He has visited many beautiful countries. One of them was

Line dancing Thousands of people in Britain have a new hobby — line dancing. In almost every town you will find clubs and classes for this new activity. 'Line dancing is easy to learn. If you have two feet and can walk then you can do it!' Fiona Lever a teacher says. The first step is to sign up for a dance course. 'You'll be given a step by step dance lesson. You are taught a basic line dance,' says Valerie Renton. You'll be able to do the steps in a routine like the French shuffle. Another thing you will need is a partner. 'Line dancing takes great technique. It takes lots of practice to master it, but once you have it is a joy to show it off to your friends. But don't try it on anyone younger than 16,' warns Renton. It's not only a pleasure to watch, but also a good way to develop confidence and friendship. But what about a partner? 'There are a lot of different forms of line dancing, so to find a partner you would first have to look in your town,' says Lever. You should start out with a partner of the same gender to get to know each other. After a few months you can become a couple. But if you would like to start a line dance couple without being with a partner you can join an open dance night. Some venues will set up dances specifically for the purpose. Another option is to contact your local senior society. It is a way to develop a new hobby in a more casual setting. Line dancing takes a lot of practice and a lot of effort. 'If you can't dance you shouldn't try it, even if you can find a partner,' Valerie adds. But for people looking to take their line dancing to the

Kong went back to Ann and took her down from the high rock. For the first time in this jungle she felt strangely safe. He jumped across a ravine and then across a river. She was a small plaything between his large fingers. Then he stopped and put her down. Kong waited. There was a large tree overhead that he'd always dreamt of. But Kong was a big boy now. So he'd go to it. Kong would climb up its tall trunk and then he'd look down at Ann and wait for her.

As Kong climbed the tree he stared down at the ground. A small brown mole lived in the root system of the tree. It was small and brown and had green and yellow patches of fur. Kong knew that there would be lots of insects in this tree, so he wore a thick pair of leather work boots. They were big boots, so Kong wasn't afraid that the mole might run away from him. But it would probably be a while before the mole came to eat his food.

Kong knew that Ann wasn't real. She wouldn't live much longer. And he wouldn't ever see her again. But there was something else that he wanted to do. He wanted to walk back to where he'd left his ball and his bat. But first he had to climb the tree. He didn't know what kind of bugs he'd encounter in his boots or on the trail. But if Ann weren't real, he'd know that he'd found her in the great tree.

Dear Deshini It's great that you are my new penfriend. My name is Tom and I am fifteen years old. I was born in Canada but I live in England now. Please write and tell me all about your life in India. I would love to go there one day. You should get in touch with me and I will tell you all about the things I am doing and the things that I would like to do. I will also tell you about my favourite sport. I play cricket but in England there are bigger players and there are many matches but in India I am the youngest player. I play cricket with my friends but we always play in the park or in the playgrounds. One day we were playing in the park and the moon was shining bright and it was a lovely day so we all had a lot of fun. 
  
 Thank you Deshini 
  
 Tom 
  
 Have a lovely time 
  
 Sincerely,

Madame Tussaud's One very famous place for tourists in London is Madame Tussaud's museum. Here people can see figures of famous people made of wax. Madame Tussaud was born in France in 1761. Her uncle a doctor made wax figures of people. He opened a museum of these figures in Paris. The museum is famous for its figures made of wax. She also studied in Paris for some time. Her first attraction was the head of Napoleon. She created his portrait. After that she worked with King Charles IX. Then in 1786, she opened her own museum. When the French revolution started, she had to flee Paris and go to England. Here she stayed for 13 years. Then she went back to Paris, this time to work for King William III. Her figure of Queen Charlotte is also known as Madame Tussaud. She died in London in 1806. People love to see her figures. She is one of the most famous people in London. Some famous persons use her wax figure. She is immortal. Her figure is made from hair and flesh and she wears human clothing. People who see her figure want to touch it. For almost 100 years now, there is a queue to see the figure. When it is not in use, some famous people stand in the queue and enjoy the figures. In her day, she was more famous than her father. When she was alive, people didn't care too much about the French revolution. They just loved her wax figures. She was immortal, like the Queen Charlotte of England. 
Listing 11 detailed instructions on how to get around London in an affordable way 1. Use public transport to get around. Public transport in London is really good. You can get a bus, a tram, a tube and a train to your places

The Cerne Giant Sherborne and Dorchester are two towns in the south of England that are quite near each other. On the road between them there are a lot of green hills and fields. On one of these hills is a picture of a very large man. The man in the picture is called the Cerne Giant because the village that is next to him is called Cerne. The man has a very long face and a very small waist. On the other side of the road there is the village of Dorchester. There are no green hills at the other side. On the other hand, the Cerne Giant is always working there so he can live in Dorchester for ever. The man is very tall and very muscular. Also, he has a small face and a very big belly. It is sometimes said that the Cerne Giant lives in the Dorchester. Because of that people from the village often go to the Cerne Giant's house to ask him a question. Also, sometimes, children who are very curious go to the Cerne Giant's house. The children ask him what he thinks about some strange things. Also, the children often get really curious when the Cerne Giant gets a big wound on his leg and he has to walk long distances with a stick to his house.






(The letter that was sent to the Cerne Giant)

Dear Cerne Giant:

It is the beginning of November. There are very few leaves on the trees and some snow is falling in the sky. It is a bit chilly, isn't it? I am sure that you feel very cold and that you want to go to the Dorchester. That is why I thought that maybe we would meet again.

The Rhino There are five different types of rhino in the world today. The Black and White Rhino live in the open fields of Africa. The others live in forests in Asia. All rhinos have big heavy bodies. Their skin is very hard and they have very little hair. The great body of the rhino stands on four short legs. The long neck stretches out like a rope. The Rhino has a great horn which is used as a weapon. People in the jungles fight with the rhino to kill it. This causes a lot of problems to the rhino. For example, the horn will prevent the rhino from reproducing so it will start to die out. The horn is also used to make rhino horn. The Rhino is considered a wild animal by some people. There is a lot of poaching for the horns. People in Asian countries often cut the horn of the rhino to cure diseases. People in Africa are not as well informed about the rhino so they often buy the horn. The Horn of the Rhino is sold for over 1,000 Dollars (US$) a kilogram. There is some research into the health effects of the horn. Researchers are trying to find out whether the horn helps with cancer or other diseases. The rhino horn has also been used for religious purposes. For example, the black rhino has been used to make a black cloth which is worn as a cloth by black people. The white rhino has been used to make a white cloth. Rhino horn is also used by the African people for rituals and to cure their diseases. The horns are burned instead of consumed. The horns are so important to people in the African people because the horns are very difficult to find. It takes time to track down rhino horns so the African people often go a long way just to get

CANADA GEESE Canada Geese are large blue and white birds. When autumn arrives they have to fly south where the weather is warmer. The winters are so cold in Canada that the birds die if they stay there. Last spring Bill Lishman found sixteen young Canada Geese on his farm. The young birds were too small to stay at home and lived on the farm. The adults, however, had no place to go because of the cold winters. They stayed close to their winter home and returned to Canada in spring when it gets warmer. There are seven or eight small breeding grounds in Canada that are usually populated by Canada Geese in Canada. Canada Geese have black feet, white belly, white neck, white throat, white breast and white head. The eggs are usually blue in colour with green edges and white spots. The eggs are about the size of a Canadian dime and hatch in about five weeks. The first year that Bill Lishman had Canada Geese he found seventeen birds. Last year he counted twenty-one eggs and twelve young Canada Geese. All the geese that the farmers have been able to find are now over five years old. The geese are very important to the farmers because of the manure that they produce. They need about eight to ten pounds of manure to produce two pounds of manure every day. Geese can live up to eighteen years. Bill Lishman now has seventeen geese and the birds' breeding season is almost over. Bill's brother also owns a farm in the same county as him. On that farm are ten Canada Geese that are also over five years old. The geese have been on that farm for five years. The geese had five hens for food, and the farmer also wanted to give the geese

Dinosaurs No one has ever seen a dinosaur. The last dinosaur died about 60 million years ago a long time before there were any people on the earth. Nobody knows for sure why they all died. The nearest living relatives of dinosaurs are birds. Dinosaurs didn't all look the same. Some were as tall as the tallest living bird. Other dinosaurs were only a couple of feet tall. Some were the size of an elephant. There were even a couple of dinosaurs that looked like an entire family of crocodiles. Dinosaurs lived in deserts. Most were covered in vegetation. Some looked like plants. Others were huge swarms of dinosaurs. Some even looked like a swarm of bees. Dinosaurs lived in the desert. Most were covered in vegetation. Some were huge swarms of dinosaurs. Dinosaurs lived in deserts. Most of them were covered in vegetation. Some were huge swarms of dinosaurs. Dinosaurs lived in the desert. A good number of them were large and powerful dinosaurs. Some of them were the size of elephants. Some were only the size of a house. Dinosaurs were very fast. Some even ran away. They could run at the speed of 2 million miles per hour. Dinosaurs were great hunters. They could hunt at the speed of 100 dinosaurs per hour. Dinosaurs were not very good hunters. They usually would stay in the water and hunt fish. They didn't need to fly. Dinosaurs sometimes ate insects. They could also eat grass. They didn't need to breathe air. Dinosaurs sometimes ate insects. They could also eat grass. They didn't need to breathe air. Dinosaurs sometimes ate insects. They were mostly covered in vegetation. Piano players - when they were young Ivan Petrov Ivan was born on a farm in Russia but from the age of twelve to eighteen he studied in Poland. His first music teacher couldn't play the piano but taught him and his sister songs from the opera. His mother began to teach him the piano when he was six. At seventeen his uncle offered him to stay with him and started to live with the family. In the same year Petrov met and fell in love with Natalia Yevtushenko, a beautiful girl who played piano. On the day of the performance, Petrov and Yevtushenko were on stage and fell in love with each other and were married a year later. After their marriage they had three daughters. - It was in the year of the two-hundred-ninth festival. I remember this day very well. Natalia had arranged everything and invited everyone to see the performance in the evening. We were the last guests at the party. I couldn't get over my memory, that day because I was so happy that I played the piano for the last time. I got nervous, but Natalia didn't have any doubt about my capabilities and was glad about it. The next day when I arrived at the rehearsal hall, my friends and teachers were there too. We began to play, but after five minutes they came and said "Don't play any more; you're going to play the second piece." I couldn't understand how can they force me to play such a piece of music. I couldn't play and was very upset. Natalia came up to me and put her hand on my shoulders. We held each other for about three hours; we were in love and in love and we were in love! After that day we went together and continued to play

After a long hard swim Pedro Serrano fell onto a beach tired but alive. There was no sign now of his broken ship lost under the waves. He waited for other sailors from the ship to arrive on the island. But no one came. The next morning Serrano looked around the island that saved his life. He saw the wreck where the ship had sunk. He was very happy to see it. But he was not the only one that did. Pedro Serrano was an only person in this island who was able to see it, too. How did that happen?Serrano had a strong belief that every living thing has a soul. He had heard that this island was the source of those souls, which were connected with the other worlds. Because it is a strange and beautiful island, people had never left their soul. This was a place where people could meet again and again to talk and look for their souls.
In the beginning, they found it very hard to believe that they would meet their souls again after some time without seeing them. However, after all the time they waited, they did see. They had the most amazing dreams where they could see and talk with their souls. Even though they knew it was impossible, their heart was very happy when it happened. Serrano was very happy, too. He thought that he should go on and tell these people that they must find their souls now. He wanted them to feel the power of their connection with other souls. This way, he was very happy that he saw this island. Even though he was in terrible condition, he had the most amazing dream. He knew that he must tell his friends about it.

They went there to help make a road through a forest between two big towns. 'It was very difficult because there was no water to drink and no shops where we could buy food' said Mary. 'That was the worst part of the trip because we had to go into a forest with only one torch light. 'That way we could see how much work we had to do to finish the road. There were many big fights at that time. People fought on horses with swords in their hands. The strongest and best knight always won. 'Perhaps the new king will come to the fight' thought the Archbishop. Sir Ector went to the fight with his two sons Sir Kay and young Arthur. Sir Ector was the youngest but he was the best knight in the kingdom. The Archbishop was very worried and anxious about it. As the king arrived he did not look well. Sir Ector had received a blow that broke his arm, but he did not care about it. Sir Kay tried to console him. 'Don't worry, the King is fine, he has only broken his arm. As his arm is very strong it will heal fast. His body is very handsome too and he will be a great king' said the Archbishop. Sir Kay did not think much about the King. He went to the fight and tried to make up with Sir Ector. When they came to the fight the Archbishop said, 'You should go and speak to him, he will have more courage if you speak to him' and Sir Kay thought about it. But he decided that he would only speak to his father. He went to the king and talked to him. The King was angry that he had not come to the fight. 'Well, why did you leave? You could have come with us if you wanted to' he said. 'Father, I did not want to see you so angry. As you know I am not a good king and I should not have broken my promise. I am sorry I have forgotten about you and your family'.' Sir Kay said, 'I think it is very good of you to take responsibility for your family, it is good of you to ask forgiveness

A great idea! Frazer and Peter are two 14-year-old boys who grew up in the same small Canadian town. They have always been friends and classmates. Like all their other friends they enjoy going fishing or swimming at weekends. But for the last few months they've spent every weekend in Peter's room working on his laptop. This is due to a family dispute. Since they work together so much they've decided to start a business. They want to make a business card of some kind and sell it to each other. The last thing they need is money. So they decide to look for an advertising job in their town. Frazer approaches his father, who is a contractor. Peter, however, refuses as he doesn't want to advertise their services. But he still wants to work hard and earn money. The situation is complicated by the fact that their father, like everyone else, has no idea how to advertise their services. That's why they look online. Finally they decide to advertise in the local newspaper, as they think this will be more popular. The article was published in the newspaper and they are very happy with the result. The local newspaper is one of the best-selling newspapers in their town. For almost two weeks now they've been selling their business card online. The card is very expensive: each card costs around $2,000, but they make sure it's worth it! After all, they've spent almost two months working on it. They will soon receive the first orders. The order will be for a million business cards. Their father is very proud of their success. But what will become of them? Who will want to order their card? How much will it cost? And what will happen when the first million cards are sold?They are two very successful 14-year-old

'What did you talk about when the ghost was in your room?' asked Wish. 'Did he tell you about his life?' asked Sanderson. We wanted to know more about our friend's visitor. We started to believe Clayton too. It was only a story when he started and Clayton told very good stories. What he said about the ghost being a scientist was true. He told us that, when he was young, he invented many things and he published one book but he lost it and didn't find it again. The next time he had a bad dream and he was the only person who was not dreaming it. However, when he opened his eyes, he saw his grandfather. He asked him why he appeared so suddenly in his dream and why he disappeared after ten minutes. Grandfather told him that it was the way the wind blew and he has been walking for a while and he had some kind of headache. He told him to leave it and go for a bit. Then, he told him, "Son, I'm going to go." Wish did not believe him. He asked him, "Why you go so quickly?" Clayton said he didn't know why he went. His mother told him not to believe his father. He started to tell us everything that had happened to him and he was very frightened at the end. That night Wish and his friends were very scared and wished there was someone who could protect them from ghosts. CROCODILES We can find crocodiles in tropical parts of the world for example Africa South America and Northern Australia. They spend most of the time in slow-moving water but they can move fast through the water and on land. You often see crocodiles together in large groups. They eat everything they catch like fish birds and small animals. These crocodiles are called crocodylians.
LIVE BEARS There are a lot of live bears. Usually these bears live in the tropical zone because there are lots of trees in the forest. Bears in the Arctic, Antarctic and Northern North America are known as Polar Bears. They eat caribou, arctic foxes sea lions, walruses and salmon. These bears have many cubs. They have a large territory.
CROCODILE SPOTTERS These are crocodile fishermen in Australia and other places. They catch crocodiles and take them back to their country. They call them snapper because the crocodiles are a snapper. They use their hands to remove the crocodiles from the water and set it aside. You see crocodiles in the water all the time.
CROCODILE SNAKES Crocodiles have special eyes to see and find their prey. When the crocodiles are in the water they see the water in a big way. Sometimes they can see animals swimming far below and far below. They can smell the food of the crocodiles. This is how they know what to eat. Some of the crocodiles have good eyes and some poor eyes. Some can see better than others. The bad eyes of crocodiles help them to hunt for food. They can catch bigger animals like crocodiles.

One day in November 1982 Obama got a phone call from a stranger-his aunt in Nairobi. I am your Aunt Jane. Your father is dead" she told him. After a night with friends in a bar Obama Sr.'s car went off the road and into a tree. He died in Kenya at the age of forty-six. At the ceremony Obama Jr. had to make a decision: to continue his father's work, or to follow in his footsteps and follow his own destiny. That night Obama Jr. went out to meet with his uncle. The next morning Obama Sr. was taken to Nairobi Airport, and he took a plane to his death in South Africa. Obama Jr. lived in his father's house, he had finished school and worked for a while, but then his father had to go, so he returned to work for his father's business. Obama Sr. was always in touch with his son, and Obama Sr. wanted his son to do something great. Obama Jr. visited Nairobi and then returned to his father's house. On his way back home he made a special trip to the Nairobi's National Monument. During that trip he met his wife. They are now married. Obama Jr. lives in the US and is working in the US embassy in Nairobi. He also helps with the projects he did while working for his father's company. In his free time he likes to hunt and to run on the road. He also works with the US embassy. One day in May 2011 Obama Obama made his first speech at the White House. 
  
 On December 29th, Barack Obama was elected the 44th President of the United States.

Dear Keira Thank you for your letter. I had my first day at my new school today. A girl called Nicole looked after me and showed me where the classrooms were. She is very nice and I am going to visit her this weekend. My favourite lesson today was Maths and I was happy because I knew more than the other girls. I would recommend this school to anyone because it is well organised and has a nice staff. I am looking forward to my second day tomorrow. Yours faithfully, Laura It was good fun today. I learned a lot about music. It was interesting because we were dancing. My favourite was when we did the first time of the big number. I really liked this dance because we were all doing our favourite song, 'My Funny Valentine' by The Chiffons. It was so good because all of us enjoyed it. I would like to learn the second dance because I liked it so much. I hope you are happy with the letter and I look forward to seeing you soon. Love, Laura It was great to see you again. It was nice to have my lunch together with you and I had a very good time. We went to the ice cream parlour and I tried a chocolate bar which I have never had before. That is what I loved about my day, the ice cream. I am looking forward to the weekend so much. Love, Laura.
Dear Keira I hope you are well and have enjoyed your holiday. I have been reading your letter and am very happy about your arrival at university. I have noticed how well organised your school is and I think that it will be very good for you. I will continue to follow what is going on in your life. Love, Laura. It was a lovely sunny day. I stayed at the beach and played volleyball, and

I also moved some guns and other things to this bigger cave. I wanted to have guns near me when I was at my country house. I was more intelligent than 500 cannibals! Every morning I took some guns and walked about three miles to my place on the hill. I went and got my things and then I slept, until the next morning. I woke up about 10 minutes later with a great fear and a bad sense of the wind. I could not find the guns. I searched everywhere for them. I searched for 2 days and then I saw one of them behind a pile of rocks, in the water, a hundred metres away. I was absolutely delighted! I went and got the gun, and then I walked three miles back to my house with the best sleep of my life.

When the Mayor heard about Jack's fall from the sky he sadly told everybody in his town. They all looked down at the ground. They didn't scream or shout. They stood and remembered their great friend. "We will never see our dear friend Jack Skellington again" the Mayor said. "This is a very sad day for us all." Everybody felt very bad but nobody was sadder than the Mayor. "So we can go to the next town and say goodbye to Jack." "Maybe the next town will have a party to celebrate our friend" the Mayor suggested. "So we can go to that next town together." But nobody agreed to go anywhere to celebrate the life of their friend Jack Skellington. The Mayor sighed. He was going to his home and he was not going to wake up tomorrow. "Jack was a very special boy. He will never be forgotten by our town." Everybody said this and they all understood. But nobody agreed to go to the next town because they are all very sad. But the Mayor was not going to sleep yet and he was going to talk to his wife. So they were all going to visit him in his house. But when they arrived at his house, they all felt very sad again. "But I am going to change this mood. I am going to sing to the Mayor. I am going to sing a song to cheer him up." "Come on, let's play music in the night. Let's make the mayor happy. HOW DO THE IRISH POP-GROUP 'BOYZONE' LIVE A HEALTHY LIFE? Sleeping well is very important. When I can get home to my mother's house I sleep for ten hours. But I find it very difficult to sleep at night after a concert because my head is full of music. Sport is important. I play three times a week with the boys: one week on the tennis court, another week on the bicycle or on the trampoline, and a final week when we go to the soccer or football pitch. It's not an easy task: if you do it you will feel the fatigue. You need a lot of passion and motivation to do it. But then you come out of the pitch feeling energised and you can do something else very interesting. I eat very well. I'm not a foodie. I like to cook a bit, but I don't like eating. I love food! However, I have to eat when I'm hungry because I have a job to do. I only have three meals a day: once in the morning, once in the afternoon, and once at night. I never go to sleep hungry. If I've had food, I've had a good meal. I am a man of a lot of energy! I always try to go out for walks, but there's always something to do. I really love the countryside, so I go on a hike every weekend. I can go on the highest mountain if I have a partner. 
  
 You seem to have a great attitude towards food. How does that work? First, you have to know what you want. You know what you want to eat after two or three songs. So, I know what I'm going to have and what I'm not going to eat.

THE HISTORY OF THE LONDON POLICE Today there are policemen everywhere but in 1700 London had no policemen at all. A few old men used to protect the city streets at night and they were not paid very much. About 300 years ago London was starting to get bigger. The city was very dirty and many people were poor. People from other towns were coming to London to seek employment as well as to steal or rob. The police began to patrol the streets. This is how they started patrolling the streets: They first formed a line, and walked along the streets to look for any suspicious movements. They used dogs and horses to search the streets. After the police found something suspicious, they followed it with the help of their horses. They then walked along the street to look for any people moving from one place to another. They made notes of people’s movements. At night when the police didn’t have to worry about their patrols being interrupted, they could drink. This is how the idea of the London Police was born. In the future, we will all be able to contact the police instantly, without having to wait for hours and hours to be taken to jail. It is not a new idea, but it is still a good idea because it will make the police officers very professional. The policemen, once they have finished their patrols, will sit down on a big table, and talk about the day’s problems. In the afternoon there will be a cocktail party for the officers and their friends. Police officers usually don’t get any extra money when they don’t arrest anyone. Mount Kilimanjaro Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa. Many people have climbed Kilimanjaro from a seven-year-old boy to an 87-year-old man. There are several paths to the top. People think that the five-kilometre Marangu path is the easiest. It takes about five days and is very popular with tourists. The shorter but more difficult Machame route is popular. It takes about three days and is less popular with tourists. The mountain is also accessible for people who want to climb it with a guide. The guide gives you the route to the top and also helps you reach the summit. Many climbers have died on the mountain. Source: Wikipedia

The Young Achiever of the Year Kal Kaur Rai has always been interested in fashion and has just won the title of Young Achiever of the Year at the Asian Business Awards. Ever since she was a child she has drawn clothes and designed patterns. She never told her hard-working parents who own a supermarket that she wanted to turn her hobby into a career.
Kal Kaur Rai is a 25-year-old from India who, after losing her job due to Brexit, was looking for a new career when she decided to pursue her passion for fashion at the Asian Business Awards.
The 25-year-old works for the store Primark, where she designs items which are sold in the Asian continent as well as sold outside.
The Young Achiever of the Year award is given to the youngest person who has achieved great success in their chosen career. Each year, an Asian Business Awards category is set up to recognise, celebrate and pay tribute to outstanding young people who have excelled and achieved something great. The Asian Business Awards are held in London each year. The Asia Society runs the event in association with the UK-based magazine, Asian Business, and the Asia Business Awards Foundation, supported by Barclays, is set up to help promote and support young people in Asia in particular.
The Asian Business Awards is hosted by Jack Ma at the Royal Opera House. This year, the Asian Business Awards Foundation was created to help young people and those in Asia to develop their career potential.
The Young Achiever of the Year award winner is also crowned as Asia’s Young Achiever of the Year and also goes down the route of being named Asia’s Young Achiever of the Year. Kal Kaur Rai is the youngest Young Achiever of the Year of all time. She said she is inspired by people

THE ICEHOTEL For many years the Arctic was a popular destination in the summer season to see the land of the midnight sun but in winter the few inhabitants had the snow and ice to themselves. By the end of the 1980s it was decided that the dark and cold winter should be seen as an advantage. After a series of feasibility studies, the International Arctic Research Center of the University of Alaska Fairbanks was formed in 1984. The first permanent icebreaker, “Rasputin”, was built by Soviet builder “SKA-NII” in 1985. In 1992 the Russian Arctic Expedition Team (ARET) was formed by the Ministry of Defence of Russia for a long, multi-year expedition in the Arctic Ocean. In 1993 the team became a part of the Arctic Scientific Research Centre (ASRC) of the University of Alaska in Fairbanks. A year later, the ARET started its first long-distance expedition with the ship “Akademik Shokalskii” in the summer of 1994. Since then the ARET has carried out various long-distance cruises in the Arctic and other polar seas. These cruises have often proved to be the highlight of the entire trip, as in 1999 the “Arctic Explorer” sailed from New York to Alaska in the first-ever circumnavigation of the North Pole and back. Since then, two further Arctic expeditions have been carried out with the purpose of setting new records for the longest unbroken and unsupported cruise in the world. In 2005 the team set up the icebreaking platform “Aleut” in the Arctic Ocean. After six years of operations the icebreaking platform was decommissioned. In 2007, the ARET carried out the world’s first

Climbing to the top of Britain Each year thousands of people climb Ben Nevis in Scotland and because of its northerly location the climate can be bitterly cold. Climber Keith Hewitt describes his first time on Ben Nevis. It was February my first big winter climb. Our route was up the north face of the mountain to Tower Ridge. After about 45 minutes up the steep slope to Tower Ridge we got to the foot and we sat in a circle on the snow just waiting for the guide. We stood there watching each other look up at the massive mountain. I have to admit my nerves started to get the better of me. This mountain has been climbing since the late 1950s and the guide told us that it’s considered one of the hardest mountains in the world to climb. It is covered in snow on the top of the ridge and after two hours on the mountain it was too cold to continue. There are few ways to get up this mountain and most people use a rope to get to the top. That’s when it hit me. I wanted to do it with a rope. After two hours of sitting in that freezing circle waiting for the next group to turn up, I had my moment. I was the last one to turn up and I climbed to the top of the mountain. The views from the top are incredible. I was able to get a few pictures that day to add to my collection. I was in heaven. I had completed my first big winter climb. It was a special moment in my life that I will never forget.

Being an older student At 32 I have just finished my first year at university. As well as attending lectures regularly I have had to learn to read books quickly and write long essays. I decided to go to university after fourteen years away from the classroom. As a secretary although I was earning a reasonable amount of money I was bored doing something where I hardly had to think. By the time I entered university I was very much interested in learning something more challenging than waiting for people. Also I realised I was missing my social life. I have only ever worked in an office with two people and I really wanted to make that my life from now on. I enjoy my course and the people I have met in the course. One of the greatest things about university is that it gives you the opportunity to make the right decision for the rest of your life.

Maria Mutola In 1988 Maria Mutola was playing football as the only girl in an all-boys team in a local competition in Mozambique. 'We won' she said. 'At first no one thought it was a problem that I was a girl. But then the team we beat complained.' The story appeared in a local newspaper and Jose Craveirinha who had encouraged other African athletes learnt about Maria. Soon after Jose arranged for a trip to London, and a career in the sport. But despite Maria's success at football she was not allowed to represent Mozambique in the Olympics. Maria is a great example of the benefits that sport can bring to an individual's physical and psychological well-being. She is one of the few Olympic champions that did not suffer sexual harassment from her coaches. This was an achievement that should not be forgotten.'Maria Mutola was playing football as the only girl in an all-boys team in a local competition in Mozambique. 'We won' she said. The Albuquerque Balloon Festival Every autumn the sky above the desert city of Albuquerque in the south-western United States turns into a mass of bright colours. This is the Albuquerque Balloon festival an annual nine-day event. The first festival was held in 1972 to celebrate the 50th birthday of the local radio station. It has since become a major annual attraction, attracting hundreds of thousands of people from throughout the United States and internationally. This huge gathering of spectators and participants gives Albuquerque a unique reputation as an international tourist centre. Over 700 helium-filled balloons are released from balloons for all sorts of purposes, including performing tricks such as aerial acrobatics over the crowd. In order to compete with the larger festivals in the United States, the Albuquerque festival has adopted an aggressive promotion strategy to publicize its activities. It also tries to give the appearance of being a relatively safe and pleasant event. The Balloon Fiesta has become an international tourist destination, drawing over 1.4 million visitors annually since its inception. The Balloon Fiesta has attracted more than 40,000 pilots over the years, who fly to Albuquerque to participate in the festival. The festival also promotes Albuquerque to pilots. Ballooning is a skill like any other. Competitors need to have a very high level of skill in order to achieve successful jumps. Albuquerque, like the rest of the United States, has experienced record-breaking levels of hot, sunny weather, making it one of the more popular locations for ballooning. The city was not the ideal site to host this large-scale festival, since balloons in the past have landed with devastating results. There has been a lot of damage due to storms. As a result, several years ago the Albuquerque Balloon festival had to be moved away from the city for several years so that the festival could be held in a better location

THE ROCKIES The Rocky Mountains run almost the length of North America. They start in the North-west but lie only a few hundred miles from the centre in more southern areas. Although the Rockies are smaller than the Alps they are no less wonderful. There are many roads across the Rockies but the best way to see them is to travel by train. The Rockies get their name from the rock formations that line the path of the railway. Each of the mountain ranges is named for its rock formation, and the Rocky Mountains are the second highest mountain range in the world. Although the weather is generally bad at higher altitudes, the scenery along the way is spectacular and it is well worth taking the time to see the Rockies by train if you can. From North Carolina they head east in a series of mountain passes. This section follows the course of the Great River which courses in the Rocky Mountains. Rocky Mountain National Park is situated along the Colorado River. Along the way they also pass through several other beautiful valleys and peaks. Rocky Mountain National Park is one of the greatest mountain parks in the world. Some of the peaks are named after people who have been living there for centuries or have even been buried by the mountains. You can see some of this heritage in the towns on the trail, but most of all you can see this wilderness, where nobody lives but mountains. The railroads in the Rocky Mountains can be traced all the way back to the Colorado River in North Carolina. The Rocky Mountains can seem inaccessible when you are up on the plateau, but you can travel up them in a day or two by train. The main railway runs through the mountains and passes over many small streams, so if you are able to travel from the centre you can take a train to the top. Detective-Inspector Cornish and Chief-Inspector Craddock were discussing the murder at the local police station. 'Mrs Bantry said that Marina Gregg had a "frozen look"' said Cornish. 'Did she see someone on the stairs? There were two people from America - Ardwyck Fenn and Lola Brewster a film star. They had no luggage and had no passports,' said Craddock. 'The police are searching Ardwyck Fenn's house but so far they have nothing. He could easily fly across the Atlantic if he wanted to escape,' said Craddock. 'But what he did want - and that is what the police want to find out - is that famous painting. And they have the wrong man.' 'Was it on the fourth floor?' 'Yes - and a terrible one it was,' said Craddock. 'As you know Mrs Bantry is not herself - she is terribly unwell. She saw Mr Gregg up the stairs and was surprised that he was alone. She said that he had a sort of frozen look on his face. I believe she saw him with Marina Gregg.' 'And then - the American came down the stairs in his own shoes?' 'Yes - and his shoes were black,' said Craddock. 'She didn't see Fenn's name on the door but she saw a black umbrella - and she said that it came in contact with Mr Gregg's face. A few days after this Virginia and her young admirer went out riding in the fields. But a tree tore her riding skirt very badly and when they got home she went up the back stairs to mend it. She was running past the half-open door of one of the rooms when she saw someone inside. It was her Uncle Charles who had come back after a year away visiting his family in New York. It was a very warm day and the house was very light. Uncle Charles smiled and said "Good morning Mary. How is your riding skirt? Has it not caught on something?" When she looked at him she was so scared and ashamed and said "You know Uncle, I was riding in the fields and a tree made my riding skirt very badly." "Oh my dear, how awful! I am so sorry you got hurt." He said he was going to sew the skirt to the boot. "No Uncle, I am going to change my dress. I have decided to dress very modestly in the future." She said sadly. "That is all very well my dear but until we know who is responsible for this dreadful thing, I will not allow you to change your dress. Now I must go to my room and get a better pair of riding boots. Bye." He said he would return later when he knew the culprit. So she saw him off and he went away into the city. In the meantime Mary went up to her room to change her dress. Soon she heard a sound outside and to her horror it was Uncle Charles. "Why Mary I am coming to your room now to sew the tear to your riding skirt so we may not have another such disaster." Winter Driving Winter is dangerous because it's so difficult to know what is going to happen and accidents take place so easily. Fog can be waiting to meet you over the top of a hill. Ice might be hiding beneath the melting snow waiting to send you off the road. There are so many things that could happen, so a person should be prepared and also know the law. It is very important to understand the laws about the cars in Canada. There are some things that only can be done on roadways that are not protected by ice. There is only one way to be prepared. The most important thing is to study the laws and know what is the best thing to do. If a person has a car with special equipment he or she will have a better chance of avoiding an accident and having a good time. This is an excellent way to enjoy the winter and spend time with friends and family. It will also be cheaper than going to the skiing resort. It is important to be aware of the law. It is illegal to operate on the ice without the appropriate equipment for an emergency. One should drive only at low speed on a dry road with a snowplow behind him or her. They should never go on the ice alone because they are more likely to get stuck and lose control. If you do not understand the rules of the road or the risks involved, you can get a ticket and your driver's license can be suspended. It is not the only possible result, but there are others. If a person does not have any knowledge about the laws of the road or how to avoid a danger he or she can face serious consequences. If he or she was only paying attention to the weather and the traffic signals, he or she could also face the consequences.

LITTLE CAT LITTLE CAT WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN? When Bo the cat decided to explore a furniture van she had a bigger adventure than she expected. She was discovered by the driver after he had completed a trip of over 500 kilometres. It was the end of a long day. He offered to let her have the rest of the night to sleep, a real friend would have given her food first. But the little kitten decided to explore the vehicle and discover the whole city. Unfortunately his curiosity had gotten the best of him and he got himself lost in the city. Luckily for Bo, a kind passerby saved her. So the kitten decided to run to the end of the street and find her way back. All the way she felt the joy of living her life again. This happened once in the year in a very cold wintertime. Once again we need people who can write good stories. The judges who include Mary Littlejohn the novelist Michael Brown the television reporter and Susan Hitchins Keep Writing's editor are looking for interesting and original stories.
The deadline for entries is 21 October 2016 at midnight.
Keep Writing magazine is a biweekly, magazine with a print run of 20,000 copies. It's distributed free to members and supporters and to libraries, community centres, and bookshops.
The aim of Keep Writing is to stimulate the imagination of young people by presenting their work, in words and pictures, and encouraging them to try writing and publishing books.
We have a strong commitment to writing, but there are many people with ideas and skills which aren't always considered.
What does 'winning' mean?
We'll send a shortlist of shortlisted entries to the judges for a final decision, along with the option of publishing a single winning entry or an extended shortlist with contributions from others.
The editors will be deciding on which entries are published, and we will have a small group of judges to consider the shortlisted entries. If more than 10 judges agree, a decision by a panel of six is then taken and published.
We will publish the winning entry on the website. This will include the author's name, along with the title and date of the winning entry. We will also publish the author's name on the front cover of our annual edition, and the winner's details inside the magazine.
When will the winners be chosen?

THE FIRST WOMAN SCIENTIST Hypatia was born in Alexandria in Egypt in 370 A.D. For many centuries she was the only woman scientist to have a place in the history books. Hypatia's father was director of Alexandria University and he made sure his daughter had the best education available. This was unusual as most women then had few opportunities to study. As a teenager, Hypatia began studying anatomy and the physical laws that governed nature. These were her real passions, however, and she devoted herself to them. As the years passed, the Egyptians began to open up to women's studies and the first women were students at the University of Thebes. Hypatia studied for five years before the university director forced her to leave to become a teacher. In 406 she married the astronomer and mathematician Eratosthenes and the couple had several children. He died in 399 B.C. and she became a recluse and a recluse only. In 305 B.C. Hypatia married the pharmacist and astrologer Diagoras, who lived in her town. During their marriage he often traveled with her and she traveled on his ship to Delphi to make a pilgrimage to the shrine of Apollo, then a huge god to all the Greek people. He died in 297. In 293 B.C. she wrote her famous "Theophraston," an account of one man's life and the time he spent in the wilderness. Hypatia became a teacher in Alexandria and was a great teacher in her day. She lectured at the university, at the church and at the palace. For many years she was married to the astronomer and mathematician Coponos. During one of her trips to the Delphian Temple she discovered Uranus. While traveling through the desert she saw a strange shape that made her realize it

Joining the Kirov Ballet I’m Nathalie. Last year I was one of the youngest foreign students ever to join the Kirov’s ballet school in St Petersburg Russia. At my first ballet class I was nervous as I didn’t know anyone. Everyone gathered round asking me questions all in Russian. I tried to say something in Russian and they began talking in English so we managed to communicate. Now that I am part of the Ballet School the atmosphere is very different. Everyone from across the world comes to study ballet. Everyone that comes from abroad knows the Kirov Ballet. It is always a highlight of our summer for us. In the summer there are three schools in Kirov that do classical ballet, modern and contemporary dance. These schools are the Kirov Ballet School, the Mariinsky Theatre School and the Theatre of World Performance. It is a very prestigious school and every student who is part of the school has the best of everything. We are all taught by master teachers, and we receive a lot of extra training at home. All of the students in the Kirov get the best education possible. We also have opportunities to travel around Russia. At the end of the school year we get to perform at the Moscow State Conservatory. The music we study at the conservatory also helps us to compose and perform classical music. This is a huge opportunity to perform at such an incredible place like Moscow State. It is a huge honour to get to go there! The Russian people and culture is so unique. It is an amazing experience for me to be in the Kirov for the first time. I have been on tours with a Russian ballet company before but the Kirov Ballet school takes my performance to another level. I also love the theatre in St Petersburg. The Kirov has some wonderful theatres and the ballet theatre in St Petersburg

Norwich Norwich the capital of the part of Britain known as East Anglia has existed as a place to live for more than two thousand years. It began as a small village beside the River Wensum. At the time of the Norman invasion in 1066 it had grown to become one of the largest towns in England. Norwich's medieval history was distinguished by the large number of religious houses, but also by its many mercantile organisations. It became a centre of learning with a university being founded. Norwich was taken by the English after the Norman conquest and became part of the West Riding of Yorkshire in 1204. After the Battle of Hastings in 1066, the Saxon people of the county fell under the control of the Danish King, Suthbert. After King Harold was killed, King Suthbert decided to make Norfolk an independent county. He then rebuilt the fort of Burnt Wood to keep Norfolk safe from English attacks, but was defeated at the Battle of Leyden in October of the same year. After the Viking invasion of England in 998, Norwich was captured by King Óland of Norway, who forced the inhabitants to convert to Christianity. In 1197 King John took Norwich by force, but was repulsed by the Danish king, Håkon VII Æthelweard. Norwich was the first place in England to hold a church service celebrating Christmas. It is still the first Christian city to hold its services on December 25. In 1438 Norwich entered the English Civil War, but was able to retain its liberties under the protection of the King's Armies during the winter. In May of that year, Norwich was attacked by the rebels. In a dramatic struggle between the townspeople and the rebels, which lasted two days, the townspeople managed to repel the

Sharks  Sharks are some of the most frightening creatures in our oceans. They are well prepared for feeding under water because they can see very well and they can also feel movement through special lines on the sides of their bodies. These make sharks very dangerous for smaller sea creatures that become their food. Shark attacks are very rare, but occasionally they occur. People go on safaris where they see sharks, but they don’t need to worry about shark attacks. Shark attacks usually occur in areas where people tend to swim and go fishing in the oceans. Sharks have no defense against the fishing nets that are used on many oceans, so these attacks are very common. There are many types of sharks, the largest of which are known as bull sharks. They can grow up to over 25 feet long and weigh over 15,000 pounds. Sharks don’t usually attack people, but when they do people usually survive because sharks are very strong. Bull sharks, for example, have an average attack strength of about 120 pounds per square inch. This means if you were standing next to this shark, it would take nearly 100 pounds of force to kill you. Bull sharks are not very common in North America, so most people haven’t seen them. It is estimated there are only 10 bull sharks in the entire world. Another type of shark, the hammerhead shark, can grow up to about 20 feet long and weigh about 7,500 pounds. It is rare to see a hammerhead shark in the ocean, but it is said to be one of the most dangerous sharks to humans, especially when it comes to a shark attack. Shark attacks can happen anywhere, but most of the time they occur on islands, beaches, or on ships or boats. Sharks are very scared of people,

Sweden's Ice Hotel The village of Jukkasjarvi is in Swedish Lapland and winter temperatures there can reach -40° C. But 6000 holidaymakers still go there annually to visit what is probably Europe's most unusual accommodation. In this hotel you eat drink and sleep in rooms made of ice. If you want you can even get married in one. The first guest had booked the hotel for a wedding but the minister ended up getting married himself in the same facility. The ice hotel was designed by architects Carl Östenlund and Lars Ullenhag in the 1970s in a remote part of Lapland. Its popularity grew during the 1980s and became the most lucrative hotel in Lapland. It now has almost 20 locations in Sweden. More info about Hotel Ice.

No Title The best age to start learning the violin is between three and six" says Margaret Porter a violinist and music teacher. "It's the time when you are learning about the world." Margaret who lives in London prefers to take pupils at three and four although she has made lots of exceptions for keen five-year-olds. Porter who has been teaching children for 25 years said: "The most important thing is to show them the joy of music and that it's not about performance or being a star." She said there were three stages in a child's musical education. A child learns to play the violin in the first year in a group of six students who take turns to play in front of their teacher. By the fifth grade, children who excel in the classroom are rewarded with private lessons with their favourite violinists. Porter said there is nothing wrong with starting a child's musical education at age four as there are many activities that young children can do at that age, such as singing, drawing, dancing and playing with children's toys. "At four a child can play with their toys and make up their own stories or play games." Porter added that children who are very good in a music class will have an easier time at primary school as they are seen as more confident at that stage. "They learn about the notes and how to read music," she said. Porter, who is also a senior columnist for the Telegraph, said it is important to teach children how to read music by singing together and by writing letters to their favourite music stars. "Children can also learn to play along with their favourite artists on their computers," she added. SAMUEL PEPYS The most famous diary in English was written by Samuel Pepys. It gives a detailed and interesting description of everyday life in England between 1660 and 1669. Pepys writes about important news stories of the time like disease an enemy navy sailing up the River Thames and the Great Fire of London. Also, Pepys was a chronicler of his family life, the time he lived in, his wife and children. Also, he wrote of the news from abroad. He used the diary as a record of his thoughts and feelings. It became very famous and influential in the literary world of England. Also, he died in 1692 and was buried at the church of St. Paul’s, London. He was survived by his wife Mary and their sons Samuel Jr. and Thomas. It was published in 1694. The two parts of this diary were titled The Morning and The Evening. The Morning part was written on the 3rd day of the month, the 3rd of September. The Morning part covers the events of the previous month. For example, in the month of September the diary says that the king was defeated at the Battle of Hastings. He also mentions that his queen was beheaded at the Tower. Also, he mentions a fight that took place between his son Thomas and the Queen’s steward. The event that takes place is the Battle of Hastings. The evening part is written on the 28th day of the month, the 28th of September. The Evening part covers the events of the previous month. For example, he mentions that the queen died on the 13th of September and that his son Thomas and his steward were killed at the battle of Worcester. These early foot coverings were probably animal skins which people tied round their ankles during cold weather. We still use leather today but other materials such as silk plastic or cotton are also popular depending on what is in fashion. 
Shoes are usually made up of several layers of flexible and lightweight material and usually covered in a thin layer of canvas. The Ghan Train Mark Ottaway travelled by train from Darwin in the north of Australia to Adelaide in the south. The Ghan train crosses the Australian continent from the warm northern coast through seemingly endless desert to the colder Southern Ocean. It is often called the ‘famous Ghan’ which is perhaps unfortunate since it is known above all for being late. The journey across the Australian mainland takes four days and is considered by many to be one of the greatest train journeys of all time. The train takes its name from the Northern Territory’s Ghan Valley. The Ghan Valley is where the train crosses the South Australian desert. The name originated in the late 19th century when travellers on the railway would say ‘we’ve arrived at the Ghan Valley’ to refer to the journey across the country. The name is currently used on a number of Ghan Valley tours with the aim of introducing people to the place. The Ghan Valley is the third longest continuous railway line in the world and the second longest in Australia. The length is measured along its entire length and includes branches in Queensland, NSW, Victoria and South Australia. The line crosses the Australian continent from the warm northern coast through seemingly endless desert to the colder Southern Ocean. Henry Ford Henry Ford was born on a farm in Michigan in 1863 but he did not like farming. When he was fifteen he began work as a mechanic and in 1893 he built his first car. After he had driven it 1500 kilometres he sold it and built two bigger cars. Ford had four cars in total, two Model A's and two Model T's. This is why he became famous. His most famous car is the Model T, a one-wheel, five-wheeled automobile. It was first produced in 1901 and it has only been manufactured since 1913. Since he used only American parts, it was also the most affordable car in the world for normal citizens. He could make only 4500 copies of the car in 1903. The car is now considered to be one of the most famous inventions in history. It was also the first automobile to be adapted for use in extreme weather conditions. In 1937, when he was ninety-eight, he began producing a new car, the F-1, but it was destroyed in World War II. The school, founded by the Brothers of Saint Augustine in 1870, offers an excellent combination of faith and education in a friendly and friendly atmosphere. I am sure you will enjoy it.

The owners had hoped to sell 10,000 pieces of furniture by the end of its first day. The furniture is available by appointment. It seems the opening is a success. 'We will be back for more,' said a sales assistant. 'This is the best day ever. It's so crowded you can't move, the crowds just have to know.' 'I'll go to the next one,' said a customer, who would not give his name. 'You have to earn a living. I was just a kid when this shop opened and now I'm buying the house.' 'I have got my own flat and I am buying a sofa and a dining table here,' said a customer, who would only give his name as Johnny. 'I just hope they stay open.' 'We were told by the council to close at midnight,' said a sales manager. 'You have been warned. We will open again at 6 tomorrow.' 'It's against the council guidelines,' said the spokesman, who would not be identified. 'There are many children sleeping in the surrounding streets and they are frightened by all the noise from all the shops.' The Eden Project Since it opened the Eden Project in the south-west of England has become one of the UK’s most popular tourist attractions. At first sight the huge ‘biospheres’ on this former industrial site look like a scene from a science-fiction movie. Each biosphere contains a different climate zone showing visitors just how important the relationship between people and plants is. The biospheres are also the perfect backdrop for some spectacular water features in the middle of the lake. In the centre of the lake there is the Eden Rock that stands proud above the water like a giant rock castle. At the foot of the rock is the Eden Visitor Centre. From here it is just a short walk into the biospheres to enter the hot spring and steam bath. There is a children’s play area on the edge of the hot spring. The main attraction though is the Eden Project itself. The biospheres cover more than one square kilometre and give a 360 degree view of the lake and landscape. The first attraction is the ‘Eden Project Café’. This restaurant is located in the centre of the biosphere. It offers a large menu with plenty of food options. If you are lucky enough to arrive at lunchtime the restaurant becomes fully booked but for a great tasting meal the best time is from 3 p.m. until 6 p.m. The café is open daily to allow visitors the chance to see the biospheres before heading off to their next attraction. At the visitor’s centre there is the Eden Visitor Centre. This is the ticket office where you can buy tickets for a variety of activities. San Francisco San Francisco lies on the coast of northern California. The earliest Europeans to discover the area were led by a Spanish explorer whose name was Gaspar de Portola. He first saw it in 1769. Surprisingly although San Francisco Bay is a wonderful natural harbour it was discovered by land rather than by sea. The city is located near the bay and surrounded by hills. Many famous writers and artists such as Mark Twain and William Faulkner have called the city home. San Francisco is known for many things, including its great food, wide variety of restaurants and nightlife. The city is also home to the annual Golden Gate Fairs. It is well known as a cosmopolitan city and has many attractions. There is also a huge Chinese population and they make up one of the largest religions in America. San Francisco is an important hub for the shipping and transportation industry in North America. It is home to the world headquarters for many companies. One of its most famous companies is Amazon, which has had an office in the city since 2009. It is a centre for film production. There are two major film studios - One of America's oldest is the City of London. It is home to a number of historical buildings, including the Bank of London, which was the first bank in the British Isles to be granted a charter by the King in the 13th century. This building is now used to display artifacts from the British Empire. You can also visit the Royal Mile, which is a street in the city centre. This road was opened in the 19th century and is now lined with many shops. The Royal Opera House, located on the side of the bay is a famous place to visit in the city. Also, the Golden Gate Theatre, and the Theatre of Eternal Love are both very popular. The city

STAMP COLLECTING - IT’S A HOBBY THAT CAN GROW AND GROW Millions of people of all ages enjoy a hobby which is both interesting and fun. And every year more and more people start a stamp collection of their own and discover an interest which can last a lifetime. Starting your collection is easy because stamps are everywhere. When you buy a stamp, you are not just buying an ordinary envelope, or even an ordinary piece of paper, but you are acquiring a piece of history, and history will always be there for you, if you are careful. The history of stamps, as well as those of the world, can only be enjoyed by people who are enthusiastic about stamps. It takes a very special stamp to be a collector. The earliest modern stamp, dating back to 1793, was in fact a “foolscap” (an engraving of a picture), which showed a family portrait of King George II and his wife Catherine in front of the Royal Mint. A stamp which shows the Royal Mint and the family on the first page can be found in many collections. But the most valuable stamp collection, and the oldest, belongs to the holders of the Royal Mail Service (RMS) stamps, as this stamp was first issued in 1863. The RMS stamps are issued yearly and are issued at the beginning of April each year, except during a summer holiday. They have a fixed price of 5 shillings. The stamps are printed at the Royal Mail printing works in London. To collect stamps, you must have a good memory, as each and every stamp has to be named and noted in a special notebook, which is kept in your stamp box. Hi - I'm Justin Rowlatt and I'm the BBC's 'Ethical Man'. So what does living ethically mean? Giving up the car recycling wine bottles not using plastic bags? I spent a year trying to find out. I want to be clear about one thing right from the start - it wasn't my idea to become the BBC's ethical man. Nor my plan to become a 'living' ethical man. That would be an oxymoron, wouldn't it? 'Ethical' has its roots in Christian ethical principles, which describe how we should treat our fellow man. Some ethical principles involve helping others and being ethical, others are more altruistic - such as 'do what is best for others, even if that means that you have to compromise something for your own benefit.'. I'm just one of the millions of ethical men who's been inspired by Christian ethics to try to improve the world - and make it a better place to live in. And the BBC wanted to help me make a difference, so they invited me to do some research. I will make a promise that the light will never, ever be taken from you again." We went our separate ways. But the next morning, I got the same idea I did twenty years before. We knew we could never make a mistake like that again. We started talking about what to do. But then I was not sure. I felt like I was playing a game, and I was very close to running out of time. During the past 80years over 50000 guests from 174different countries have visited Sunningdale. The hotel is on one of the main roads leading to the town centre. It has been renovated many times but always returns to its original splendor. When you enter the hotel you will notice that many of the original features remain intact, like the ornate staircase, and the stained glass window. The hotel is on the market and is open for business. The Sunningdale Hotel has accommodation for up to 300 people in 17 different rooms.
